title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 07 November 2013 - XWiki
content:
<abusenius> has quit  
00:05 <cjd> has quit  
00:05 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
00:11 <LONI\_Intern> has joined #xwiki  
00:14 <LONI\_Intern> Good afternoon. I'm having a problem enabling the Office Importer Application on my Wiki. I have OpenOffice installed on the same machine, but I can't get XWiki to recognize it. Where should I start?  
00:26 <cjd> has quit  
00:26 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
00:29 <LONI\_Intern> has quit  
00:32 <cjd> has quit  
00:34 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
00:40 <cjd> has quit  
04:28 <Denis> has quit  
06:28 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:11 <sdumitriu> has quit  
07:13 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
07:52 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
08:15 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:23 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
08:35 <evalica1> has joined #xwiki  
08:35 <evalica1> is now known as <evalica>  
08:46 <vmassol> preparing BFD reminder  
08:48 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:04 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:06 <msmeria> has quit  
09:11 <j-simard> has joined #xwiki  
09:11 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:18 <j-simard> has quit  
09:19 <j-simard> has joined #xwiki  
09:19 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
09:38 <j-simard> has quit  
09:57 <vmassol> tmortagne/Denis: I'd be curious to have your opinion on http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XE-1340#  
10:00 <Denis> vmassol: no idea what is done when a user is deleted, in regards to the security cache (so post 5.x), it shouldn't take longer than simply changing the right of that user  
10:00 <tmortagne> added comments on the issue  
10:07 <Denis> tmortagne, vmassol: good point Thomas, does he use the optimized XWikiAllGroups ? if not, just that may change it all  
10:08 <j-simard> has joined #xwiki  
10:08 <vmassol> tmortagne: 40k users means an XWikiAllGroup with 40K xobjects right?  
10:11 <Denis> vmassol: surely, except if he use the "all users is in all group feature"  
10:11 <vmassol> ah indeed had forgotten about that one  
10:11 <vmassol> that's a good point  
10:11 <vmassol> we use that on xwiki.org  
10:11 <vmassol> let me check if we have it on myxwiki.org too  
10:12 <Denis> xwiki.authentication.group.allgroupimplicit=1  
10:12 <vmassol> they're used on both xwiki.org and myxwiki.org  
10:17 <Denis> vmassol, tmortagne: regarding XWIKI-9631, we have an issue with CRaSH integration, because the name of the deps for BC as changed, and therefore, EM want to deploy bcprov-jdk6, is there a way to tell that bcprov-jdk15on is the same ?  
10:18 <vmassol> Denis: no way but we can have exclusions  
10:18 <vmassol> (at the maven level)  
10:18 <Denis> so you need to update the extension  
10:19 <vmassol> it's on contrib I think  
10:19 <vmassol> yep: https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/application-crash  
10:19 <Denis> probably yes, not my job then ;)  
10:19 <vmassol> anyone can update contrib  
10:19 <vmassol> Denis: the first thing to do is write a comment on the crash extension page in the compat field  
10:20 <Denis> is as your matter  
10:20 <vmassol> to explain that the current version of crashub app is broken  
10:20 <vmassol> not really  
10:20 <vmassol> you broke it  
10:20 <vmassol> and I actually commented about it  
10:20 <vmassol> breaking backward compat is bad  
10:20 <Denis> if we need to manage all written extension, we will die  
10:20 <vmassol> well here we know about it  
10:20 <vmassol> and it was mentioned in the pom  
10:20 <vmassol> and you still broke it  
10:20 <vmassol> so I'd say it's your job to fix it  
10:20 <vmassol> :)  
10:21 <Denis> I have added a not in the RN about the fact that BC has been update and is not binary compatible  
10:21 <vmassol> we've having a ahrd time with keeping extensions working  
10:21 <vmassol> so when we know we're breaking something we need to take some action  
10:21 <vmassol> the very minimum is to write in the comapt field on e.x.o  
10:21 <Denis> writting RN is the action that should be taken  
10:22 <vmassol> how does that help users?  
10:22 <Denis> the maintainer of the extension has to follow up  
10:22 <vmassol> no  
10:22 <vmassol> you voluntarily broke crash  
10:22 <vmassol> and you know it  
10:22 <vmassol> so you can at the very least put it in the compat field on e.x.o  
10:22 <vmassol> breaking backward compat is already bad  
10:22 <vmassol> again  
10:23 <Denis> I do not know anything about CRaSH, this was just a example of what could have been broken  
10:23 <vmassol> and you decide d to break it by tyourself  
10:23 <vmassol> without asking  
10:23 <vmassol> even worse  
10:23 <Denis> there are potential many other extension that could have been broken, and not only by my update  
10:23 <vmassol> sure but you know about this one  
10:23 <vmassol> you just tested it  
10:23 <vmassol> so please fill the compat field on e.x.o  
10:23 <Denis> upgrading to the latest version of a library is a normal process, especially since it fix security issues  
10:24 <Denis> I 'll do to be please with you, but my feeling is that is not fair for other extension maintainer  
10:24 <vmassol> so you're refusing to help keep e.x.o up to date  
10:24 <vmassol> very nice mentzilty  
10:25 <vmassol> me,tality  
10:25 <vmassol> mentality  
10:25 <vmassol> :(  
10:25 <Denis> I just say, I will do  
10:25 <vmassol> you test something, it break and you don't want to report it  
10:25 <vmassol> that's all I was commenting on  
10:25 <vmassol> you made it generic  
10:25 <vmassol> we don't have any generic way to validate extensions  
10:26 <vmassol> so it has to be manual ATM  
10:26 <vmassol> and this is a hard job  
10:26 <vmassol> sorin/manuel help quite a lot but it' s up to xwiki community at large to help do this job ATM  
10:26 <vmassol> if we want to have satisfied users that is  
10:26 <vmassol> :)  
10:26 <vmassol> because right now I hear a lot of complaints  
10:27 <vmassol> about users who try extesnions and find that they are failing  
10:27 <vmassol> (out of 5, usually 3 are failing)  
10:27 <vmassol> (that's what they tell me/us)  
10:27 <vmassol> so we do have an issue  
10:28 <vmassol> one solution would be to change the way our dep mgmt work  
10:28 <Denis> IMO, maintaining extension is the job of the extension maintainers, do you think any other software editor, having extension like Chrome, take any care to check them for compatibility ?  
10:28 <vmassol> ie not allow installing by default a version that is higher than the declared dep  
10:28 <vmassol> for example if the extensions says it need platform-xxx-5.2  
10:28 <vmassol> and you're on 5.3  
10:29 <vmassol> then it doesn't install by default unless you force it  
10:29 <vmassol> would be a pain though but if combined with community input it coud work  
10:29 <vmassol> ie  
10:29 <vmassol> if someone says: it works on 5.3 then EM would allow it  
10:29 <Denis> could be something we need to do, I agree with all you say, do not be mislead by may earlier talk  
10:29 <vmassol> a bit complex to set up though...  
10:30 <vmassol> ok  
10:30 <vmassol> thanks  
10:30 <vmassol> denis: re "maintaining extension is the job of the extension maintainer"  
10:30 <vmassol> that doesn't help us  
10:31 <vmassol> from the POV of users, they see "xwiki"  
10:31 <vmassol> and it works or it fails  
10:31 <vmassol> Denis: ofc, I know that  
10:31 <vmassol> ofc there will be some verified app stores in the near future  
10:31 <vmassol> but that still doesn't solve the issue completely  
10:31 <vmassol> because most users will still go the e.x.o store  
10:32 <vmassol> and we need to have a good quality level there  
10:32 <vmassol> or they'll drop xwiki since it "doesn't work"  
10:33 <vmassol> your comment is not precise enough, fixing  
10:33 <Denis> vmassol: you are the maintainer of the CRaSH extension, I really encourage you to update it ;)  
10:33 <vmassol> imagine we release 1.1 with fixed dep  
10:33 <camil7> has joined #xwiki  
10:33 <vmassol> your comment will be wrong  
10:34 <msmeria> has quit  
10:34 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
10:34 <Denis> when you release, you need to update, no ?  
10:34 <vmassol> if we remember yes  
10:35 <vmassol> compatibility field could be improved  
10:35 <vmassol> and could be linked to a version  
10:35 <vmassol> Denis: yes, I've improved it too  
10:35 <vmassol> we could have several objects for comapt field  
10:35 <vmassol> with a version field in those xobjects  
10:36 <vmassol> in the same way that we have RN depend on a version  
10:36 <vmassol> actually  
10:36 <vmassol> it could be part of the RN xobject  
10:36 <vmassol> one field for the RN per say and one field for compat info  
10:37 <vmassol> that would probably make more sense  
10:39 <Denis> agreed  
10:41 <Denis> BTW, why the CRaSH API has no entry on e.x.o ?  
10:41 <vmassol> just created http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9642  
10:41 <vmassol> Denis: because I didn't want to expose it/document it  
10:42 <Denis> this confuse me, since it was a stated deps of the other one, and in fact the one to fixed  
10:42 <Denis> and, I was wondering what it contains, since there is already two extension using it  
10:43 <vmassol> ?  
10:43 <vmassol> two extensions?  
10:43 <vmassol> using what?  
10:43 <Denis> yes there is a CRaSH console by Jerome  
10:43 <vmassol> yes but it's not using the api I created  
10:43 <Denis> doesn't this one also based on it ?  
10:44 <vmassol> hmm  
10:44 <vmassol> let me check  
10:44 <vmassol> no it doesn't  
10:44 <Denis> no, in fact it seems to have another similar deps in contrib  
10:44 <vmassol> mine is using org.xwiki.contrib:application-crash-api 1.0  
10:45 <Denis> but reading fast I see it the same  
10:45 <vmassol> jerome's is org.xwiki.contrib:xwiki-crash-api 1.2  
10:45 <Denis> this one is probably broken as well, I do not know  
10:45 <vmassol> no idea  
10:45 <vmassol> when I released my extension I added the warning on jerome's  
10:46 <vmassol> (after contacting him)  
10:46 <vmassol> "This extension is not maintained anymore. See this http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/CRaSH+Integration for a more complete and recent CRaSH integration in XWiki."  
10:47 <Denis> curiosly, that one does not request BC  
10:48 <vmassol> ok  
10:52 <Denis> vmassol: so XWiki Contrib - CRaSH integration - API 1.2 is not related to your version, and not maintained ?  
10:53 <Denis> this is absolutely not obvious from the EM interface, maybe what we need first is to improve the way user may trust extension  
10:54 <Denis> actually this one is publish with "by: XWiki Development Team", and description "Service API for the XWiki CRaSH integration"  
10:56 <Denis> vmassol: BTW, the unmaintained version works ;)  
10:56 <vmassol> nice :)  
10:58 <vmassol> Denis: re xwiki dev team, I know, I pinged jerome several times about it. I don't think he'll change it so I'll unplug the sync and fix it  
10:58 <vmassol> hmm no it's correct: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/CRaSH+Console  
10:59 <Denis> it is the dependency I talk about  
10:59 <vmassol> http://maven.xwiki.org/releases/org/xwiki/contrib/xwiki-crash/1.2/xwiki-crash-1.2.pom ?  
11:00 <vmassol> it's missing developers section yes  
11:00 <vmassol> ah I know  
11:01 <vmassol> I've already removed the auto sync  
11:01 <vmassol> since jerome was not updating it  
11:02 <vmassol> and I manually put his name  
11:02 <vmassol> this is another issue we have  
11:02 <vmassol> extension authors always forget to put devleoeprs info and if not there we consider it to be xwiki dev team  
11:02 <vmassol> this is wrong  
11:02 <vmassol> in this case we should say "unknown"  
11:02 <vmassol> I'll create a jira issue for this  
11:03 <Denis> for sure, since "dev team" make the feeling we can trust it  
11:04 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9643  
11:04 <vmassol> this is quite important actually  
11:05 <vmassol> could alsmot be a bug  
11:10 <Denis> it is  
11:45 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki

13:21 <sburjan> has quit  
13:26 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
13:53 <vmassol> hmm I wonder why we have a VNC issue with this build: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform\_Sonar/  
13:53 <vmassol> the config correctly mentions to start vnc before the build starts  
13:55 <vmassol> hmm something is amiss related to git  
13:56 <vmassol> maybe not  
13:56 <vmassol> just strange logs  
14:08 <npst> has joined #xwiki  
14:11 <npst> why hello there  
14:14 <npst> so, concerning my installation of xwiki, for "reasons" it was decided that the "follow-user" option has to go  
14:15 <npst> am i right to assume that it's the watchlist api and hence part of the core extensions?  
14:15 <j-simard> has quit  
14:15 <npst> commenting out the watchlist line in xwiki.cfg does nothing, the "follow user" button still appears in each user profile.  
14:16 <npst> i'm looking to remove that option alltogether. any directions?  
14:16 <j-simard> has joined #xwiki  
14:22 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
14:24 <vmassol> npst: hi  
14:24 <camil7> npst: I think watchlist actually has little to do with the "follow-user" thing; watchlist is for pages , and teh follow-user mostly for messages user can post in the avticity stream (but I might be mistaken)  
14:26 <vmassol> XWikiUserSheet  
14:26 <vmassol> #if($isMyProfile)  
14:26 <vmassol> #end  
14:26 <vmassol> if you remove these 3 lines you should not get the Network tab anymore  
14:27 <vmassol> (npst)  
14:27 <camil7> I think there is also a button in XWiki.XWikiUserProfileSheet - visible if one sees another users profile  
14:28 <vmassol> camil7: yes he also needs to remove the follow button  
14:29 <vmassol> npst: search for follow in XWikiUserProfileSheet  
14:31 <npst> ah, i grepped a lot of follows earlier, i will look there specifically. thanks :)

15:46 <cjd> it's a mac and it crashed? Doesn't sound like a coincidence to me ;)  
15:47 <polx> has quit

15:49 <vmassol> cjd: you think it's NSA who crashed it?  
15:50 <msmeria> has quit  
15:50 <vmassol> (to install a newer rootkit version)  
15:50 <cjd> nah, just a mac being a mac  
15:50 <cjd> or maybe you have #badBios  
15:50 <vmassol> mac is a unix  
15:51 <vmassol> my uptime was at least 2 months (since I upgraded to maverick)  
15:51 <vmassol> hehe  
15:51 <cjd> that's pretty good  
15:51 <cjd> ubuntu desktop is no good for uptime, you really have to shut it down like daily
